content: then graft the toe using kitchener stitch you can eliminate ears by treating the 2nd and 3rd stitches from each end as a single stitch when grafting so when you knit on or knit off you pass the needle through both stitches as if working a k2tog and when you purl on or purl off you pass the needle through both stitches as if working a p2tog this might be a little fiddly but it has the effect of continuing the decrease pattern while grafting finishing weave in all ends make a second sock - if you are knitting size s or l don t forget to start the chart at row 9 this time capacitor socks v1 0 - shuyi wu - 4 charts there are two versions of the chart they are exactly the same except the colours are inverted the first chart has light mc and dark cc and the second chart has dark mc and light cc use whichever chart matches your yarn choices the best there are written instructions for the chart as well at the end light mc + dark cc capacitor socks v1 0 - shuyi wu - 5 dark mc + light cc written instructions row 1-2 cc *sl1 k3 * repeat to end row 3 mc *k1 sl1 k5 sl1 * repeat to end row 4 mc *k1 sl1 p5 sl1 * repeat to end row 5-6 cc *sl1 k7 * repeat to end row 7-8 mc same as row 3-4 row 9-10 cc same as row 1-2 row 11 mc *k3 sl1 k1 sl1 k2 * repeat to end row 12 mc *p3 sl1 k1 sl1 p2 * repeat to end row 13-14 cc *k4 sl1 k3 * repeat to end row 15-16 mc same as row 11-12 capacitor socks v1 0 - shuyi wu - 6
